name: [Don't play this] Weyland Shutdown
description: Single-minded Weyland Shutdown deck for research purposes. Don't actually play this; it's really bad.

name: NBN: Making Nuisance
description:
So, this deck was born when I asked myself: "how can I really annoy the runner?" NBN was chosen because of easy tagging and a lot of good punishment in faction (Psychographics, Closed accounts) as well as ice with some nasty effects either on encounter or if the subroutine fires. This allows me to mess with their grip, their stack and gives me more control over the game. I can win either by scorching (after invading his privacy) or scoring agendas out of hand via psychographics. I don't even need to set up a remote which I think is kinda nice too.

The only card I am not sure about at the moment is midseason, since it feels kinda unneeded at the moment. The runner will float a lot of tags at some point thanks to Bernice May and ChiLo. Maybe I'll have to try it out vs don't-tag-me runners first before I come to a conclusion whether to keep midseason or not.

name: Ice Eater
description: The main purpose is to decrese the strength of the ices with datasucker, bishop and parasite and then get over them with the breakers. This deck is based also in viruses, the corp trashes I&D and allows you to steal from archives. I have checked it in many games and I got quite good results.

name: First Jinteki Deck Back
description: Played a couple games when the core set was released. Trying to get back into it.... this is my first go since. Thoughts? Be brutal I am learning.

name: NBN TWIY* burning down the house
NBN TWIY* burning down the house v2
Painting on STIMS!!!
description: This deck has been tested in several games and is quite effective. Runs are cheap. first two ice on every run is a codegate, run click 3 and kati click 4 if possible. crescentus and stimhacks are aces as I can tinker or paintbrush the archer and then derez it.

name: No Such Thing as Bad Publicity
description: I really loved the idea of using the Bad Pub to my advantage. I have played this deck many times and I feel that it is pretty solid. I especially love how Ireress neutralizes the Runner's use of the Bad Pub credits; I'm thinking of switching out some of the ICE to ones that are lower cost since the one problem I seem to have is that Agendas like to linger in my hand for a little too long.

name: R&Dino Attack!
description: This deck is a lot of fun provided the economy stays strong--gotta love Kati Jones! Several times I have gotten lucky and have drawn Modded and The Toolbox early in the game which really lets you build your kit into something pretty strong. This deck slams R&D and really lets you mine Agendas from there.

name: Experimental Reina v 0.4
description:
Inspired by: http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/2678/gamers-den-2014-store-champion-1st-place-deck

Assisted by fortranmaker.

-2 Blackmail, -1 Frame Job, +3 Cyberfeeder
